name: pacifica beanie
notes:
the pacifica beanie is a crochet pattern for a beanie for men.

the hat is quick to make. it calls for worsted weight yarn. the sample hat uses knitpicks/wecrochet brava tweed.

the pattern includes written instructions using standard united states crochet terminology. it has been tech-edited and tested.

sizing and gauge

size: one size adult large

finished measurements: 17” in circumference at brim and 9” tall with 2” brim folded up.

gauge: 16 sts and 8 rows = 4” in pattern of alternating rows of hdc blo and dc blo for body of hat.

crochet supplies needed

yarn: worsted weight (#4 medium) in color of choice. approximately 200 yards.

shown: knitpicks/wecrochet brava tweed worsted (97% premium acrylic, 3% viscose), 218 yd [200 m] / 3.5 oz [100 g]:  #641427 (mink), approximately 1 skein.

crochet hook size: size h/8 (5.00 mm) or size needed to obtain gauge.

notions: tapestry needle, tape measure.

stitch key

ch = chain
dc = double crochet
dc blo = double crochet back loop only
hdc blo = half double crochet back loop only
st(s) = stitch(es)
rep = repeat

hat construction

hat is crocheted as a flat rectangle of ribbing.  then the rectangle is seamed together to make a tube.  then the top of the hat is closed, and the brim can be turned up.
